quote: ''I've always said that public office is a public trust. And government officials and employees should always be open to the scrutiny of the public.''

''(B)oboto ako pabor (sa Anti-Political Dynasty Bill) para hindi masabi na ginamit ko ang puwesto ko para paboran ang aming mga sarili. Hindi ako makikilahok sa debate dahil baka sabihin nila hinubog ko ang batas para mapaboran kami. Pero pagdating ng botohan, lalahok ako at boboto pabor d'yan.''

''If we do not pass a tax reform law now, we will be back to square one in the next Congress. Meanwhile, Filipinos, whose taxes pay our salaries, will continue to be burdened by one of the highest income tax rates in the world.''
''We will not allow any legislation that would go against the Constitution, which is the fundamental law of the land.''

''Atin ang West Philippine Sea hindi sa kanila iyan. Dapat ipaglaban at huwag nating bitiwan iyan. Dapat gawin natin lahat ng p'wedeng gawin maliban sa pakipaggiyera para pangalagaan protektahan iyan... huwag tayong bumigay, huwag nating bitiwan at huwag natin pakawalan ang ating interes.''

QUALIFIED YES
''I am open to Charter change at the beginning of any President's term. I have always opposed Charter change at the end of any President's term because the issue and question of extending term limits or removing term limits will always come into play. Second, I am more in favor of bullet amendments to the Constitution rather than a convention or calling for a complete overhaul of the Constitution. It is simpler and it will be better understood by our people if they really are in favor of it or against it.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015

''I join them in their advocacies and campaigns in working for a future that celebrates diversity of beliefs and orientations. A future that understands, recognizes and deeply respects the extremely diverse sexuality of individuals in the LGBT communities.''
''Dapat ipagpatuloy ang 4Ps, pero dapat gawing 5Ps, dapat may kasamang pangkabuhayan or livelihood.'' Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015

''Unfortunately, contractualization continues to be the norm among some private sector entities, citing the global economic crisis. Yet we read about these companies earning billions of pesos in profits. How can the government reconcile this contradiction and not act on the issue of contractualization? Hindi patas at hindi tama.''
''(P)abor ako na gawing mas affordable at accessible ang annulment kesa payagan at ipasa natin ang isang Divorce Bill.''

''Sa kabila ng mga reklamo, sa kabila ng mga ginawa, nagawa o hindi nagawa diumano niya nung siya'y pangulo, hindi makakaila na naging pangulo siya. Hindi makakaila naging sundalo siya. At dahil dun, marapat ay ibigay sa kanya ang angkop na burial rights.''
''I am one of the authors and I'm in favor of it.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015
''I was the principal author and sponsor of the compensation bill, which required them to... pay the human rights victims during the Martial Law.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015
''There is no labor export policy. What we should do is increase... so that there will more jobs here in the Philippines.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015
''Definitely. These are ongoing cases. The executive should have nothing to do with it. This is purely a court and Ombudsman matter.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015
''I am open for it. However, I think the Filipino society and people are not yet ready for that.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015

''(T)ayo na lang ang huling tatlong bansa na sa 10 taon ang elementary at high school. Sa buong mundo, 12 taon na ang elementary at high school. We are the last three countries in the world na 10 taon pa lamang. Napag-iiwanan at mapag-iiwanan tayo kapag hindi natin ginawa iyan. Ang tingin ng ilang mga estudyante at magulang, 12 taong elementary at high school, tapos apat na taong kolehiyo pa, so dinagdagan ng dalawang taong pasanin ang aming mga balikat. Binabago na rin po namin ang aming, ang ating mga batas.''
''I am in favor for it. What we lack is government support services. That's where we should concentrate.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015
''Any effort that would bring armed conflict to a permanent and just closure through peaceful means deserves the nation's support.''

''That is the decision of the courts. The executive again should not interfere one way or the other, in favor or against the granting of bail. The courts should have sole discretion and jurisdiction over it.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015
''That is a matter for the courts to decide. Any position taken by the executive regarding that would be unfair and uncalled for.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Nov. 16, 2015
